storyInfo: His plot revealed, Czcibor heads down a path of no return, while Młynar waits on his path to assassinating his target.

attributes.content: I don't believe they would just go off the grid like this. House Nearl would not simply sit around.

attributes.text: I think so too. Their disappearance is quite curious.
You know as well as I do that the trail the hunter followed to the Golden Prairie went cold three years ago. No one's seen them since.
But even if we're all thinking this, you still have to take care of old Kirill, right?
...I've been thinking these past few years. A lot of people have their eyes on House Nearl.
They envy my brothers' honors, and despise a vagabond like me.

attributes.content: But your older brother Schnitz is the greatest general of his generation. Why, with our own eyes, we saw him—
Who could deny his ability, even out of envy? Would they rather lose wars?

attributes.text: These people feel that wars are no longer necessary. Or rather, they don't want to face war anymore.
That's why they're sheathing their sharpest sword... and forcing me to return to the Grand Knight Territory.

attributes.content: But you can't go back!
As I said, House Nearl can't simply sit around...

attributes.text: Why so excited, Czcibor? And why the frown?
Not sleeping well? Worried that the people we saved could be recaptured?

attributes.content: No, I just...
I'm just thinking too much about this assassination.
...Assassination?
Oh, I'm dreaming.
Do it.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: December 1st, 2:15 A.M.
Outside Dzwonek
But...
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: Send word to the sentries inside. Do it.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Everyone, get ready to move.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: But our orders are to stay where we are.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: Kawalerielki has everything under control.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: And?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Are those words enough to break a knight's spear? Have the bolts in your crossbows turned to dust?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The campaign knights are the only protectors that the panicking people will see. Can this fact be changed? Or does the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi Kazimierz lack the courage to muster even when Leithanien bares its fangs?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Our duty cannot be changed by a single word from the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Move. This is an order.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry, sir, but you're no longer in a position to give orders.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: The Adeptus Sprawiedliwi has revoked your command. The captains and the Craftsman's Guild have already been notified.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: We fight for the glory of our knightclub, for the proper recognition of us campaign knights.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: But the Grand Knight has the authority to veto all of it.
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: ...So you won't obey?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Then I'll personally pass on my orders.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Ngh.. You...
attributes.name: Campaign Knight

attributes.content: The orders for Dzwonek have been issued. Everything shall proceed according to plan.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: All who assent, with me.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The captain sheathes his dark-red sword and marches past the camp tents.
Dozens of highly-ranked campaign knight are on duty, but they simply stand by the wayside.
No one joins him, or attempts to obstruct him. No one salutes.

I apologize, but due to a number of recent incidents, we are now required to inspect all vehicles that leave the city via the lift platform between midnight and 6 A.M. May I have your ID and documentation please?
attributes.name: Staff

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Thank you. A moment please.
attributes.name: Staff

attributes.content: And may I interest you in Dzwonek's specialty herb-flavored stockbeast jerky? It's quite a popular souvenir.
attributes.name: Staff

attributes.content: No, thank you.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: He waits impatiently, but the inspector's examination drags on.
You see Leithanien's emblem, don't you? Is this really necessary?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: —Huh?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: No need to worry about witnesses or public opinion at this hour.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: If the spire caster nullifies the bolts... you have permission to use javelins.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: No need to worry about the consequences either. None of the cities still remember how the campaign knights strike.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Hey, old friend.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You stand in my way once again.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Should I feel relieved? That you're still willing to act, after all these years?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: If you're here, then I suppose there will soon be an unexplained violent incident near Dzwonek, involving unknown parties.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Bounty hunters and campaign knights... neither should ever come anywhere near a city that marches relentlessly forward.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...I only came to pick up my sword, as promised.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You didn't come empty-handed, though.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: What about you? Your followers?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: You know the answer to that.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The Grand Knight Territory has intervened, as you hoped. The loyal knights acknowledge their new orders.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: For honor, for chivalrous order, for their long term interests... for the vain glory of their campaigns.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The Grand Knight Territory has...?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Ah, it seems you didn't know.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...The Adeptus Sprawiedliwi Kazimierz casts its eyes along bloodlines. They know all that goes on in every corner of Kazimierz. This has nothing to do with me.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: My apologies, it couldn't have been you. You would not have begged for help from the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi and the Grand Knight.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You came to convince me to turn back.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: But there is no way back, now that they've learned of the plan, and the Grand Knight has issued her orders.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Besides, I've raised my sword against my own men, to give the order to begin the operation.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Now that I know how hard it is to see a deed through to the end... it makes me admire what you did even more.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...Who do you think you are, to compare what you're doing to what I did?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I suppose I didn't provoke as many people as you.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You're not provoking anyone... you're just contemptible.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: If you're not ashamed of your own actions, then why did you go to the convoluted lengths of leaking intelligence to pit me against the delegation from Leithanien?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: No need to criticize my means. I'm simply as disappointed with you as I am with Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Oh, right.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The Adeptus Sprawiedliwi does not permit negative news about campaign knights to exist in writing. If I really did follow the order to stand down...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: What do you think would happen to me? Would I die of a mysterious illness on my way back to the Grand Knight Territory, or be forever imprisoned beneath the tower, just like you?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You're in no position to talk about my life, Czcibor.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: If you insist on trying to decide for millions of people where the battlefield should lie, then you deserve your punishment.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: It is a campaign knight's duty to fight for the common folk.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The unarmed are the first to be abandoned in war.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...You should have made a smarter choice.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Even if it didn't involve returning to the campaign knights.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: 'I should have'? I should have ran from Kazimierz? Then why have you stayed, if you truly believe that leaving was the only correct choice?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Or should I have abandoned the plan in its entirety, even if this is my last chance?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You know better than I do that Kazimierz needs true violence. It needs a war that will turn it on its head.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I've never once thought that way.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: All these years, we thought we knew each other so well. Well enough to leave certain things unsaid.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Now I'm beginning to wonder just how much of that was all a misunderstanding.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: We should have sat down to talk, like the old days. Before a campfire in a forest clearing.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...If you weren't set on standing in my way right now, I'd have picked a branch and made a spear out of it, just like back then.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You need to wake up.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Stay down, sir! There are archers nearby!
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Who are they? First last night and now this, who could be after me?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: This is no checkpoint, Aloisia! We must go!
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Inspector, I suggest you get out of the way if you don't want to be run ov—
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Now, now, don't be hasty.
Our guys have taken out the ones in your way. I suggest you relax and refrain from using Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: There are some traps here that are triggered by energy. And I doubt you'd enjoy the trip back to Leithanien if anything happened to your car.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: When did you—
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Nnnnnng—
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Sir!
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Oh, sorry.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: To put it simply, we would like this gentleman to come with us. May we have your cooperation?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Serious advice. We're all screwed if the trap blows up.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You're good, but not good enough to deal with everyone here. Can't hurt to hear me out, can it?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: There's nothing for us to discuss, mercenary.
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Oh? Are you really thinking about setting it off, just to give your master a chance to escape?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: That's why I never liked you spire casters. Nutjobs.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Chill out. This isn't worth any of our lives.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The inspector isn't one of ours. Neither are the ambushing archers.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Go on.
attributes.name: Bodyguard

attributes.content: Ah, in the mood to listen now?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Multiple groups fighting over the same objective is a fact of life in this line of work. Some people want to keep things safe, others want to watch it all burn.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Think about it carefully.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: There's a little village by the road to the southeast, about thirty minutes from here. On the highest building in the village is a shield emblem that looks like it could fall off at any moment.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It'd make our jobs much easier if you waited there.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Such a familiar light. The real Nearl.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I've read the legend of Kirill, seen the Radiant Knight's name on banners in the streets, heard of your brother's blinding light from your own mouth.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: But this is only Nearl I know.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: It's just like in that banquet of betrayal... I thought I'd open the door to see the ground covered in blood, only to find myself bathing in a rain of light.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...That was many years ago.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Indeed, being praised for old deeds is in itself a tragedy.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: What have you been doing all these years? Your sword is still sharp, your light even more disciplined.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: But there is enough power in your blade to parry even the weight of a heavy lance.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Why do you ask when you already know the answer?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Because I don't believe you're powerless.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I don't believe you couldn't have testified to Celina's innocence when she was being tried before the National Council. It would have taken a mere word.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I don't believe that she could simply vanish without a trace without you so much as casting a glance at her.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: There are many things that I feel powerless about.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: I didn't think they could trap you.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: There was no point in testifying to her innocence. None of us could have saved her.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: The old you would never have said that. You would have pushed to have the justice you saw missing from the National Council codified into law.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: There were too many forces involved. Thirteen people were convicted. One law would not have brought them justice.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: So you measured their injustice against your life, and decided it was not worth the risk.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Have you become afraid of death? Or have you simply decided that nothing is worth risking your life for anymore?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The campaign knight's blows fall hard.
His lance was intended to pierce armor and shields, creations of stone and steel.
But now, he aims his pent-up fury at an unseen foe.
You're losing your balance, Czcibor. Don't make elementary mistakes.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: One more, and it'll be more than your armor that cracks.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Ha...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: We haven't sparred in ages, have we? Maybe I'm fiercer than you remember.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: And what about you? You never considered sheathing your sword when we tried to persuade you.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Another charge.
The lance smashes against the ground, sending gravel flying with Originium Arts sparks.
Nice dodge.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You didn't care what the disgraced nobles and blackmailed merchants thought. You didn't care about warnings from on high, or whether it was all for naught...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You would have exiled yourself from the Grand Knight Territory forever, gone out in a blaze of glory for justice.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...What about now?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: If you can't do it, then stand aside and watch.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I'll do what you should have.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Who are you to judge what I should do?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Nearl's sword looks like it is simply shaking off the rain.
Scorching golden light falls upon the campaign knight's armor, leaving behind burn marks.
You, who throws his life away callously, and refuses to turn back despite knowing that there is no hope?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: ...I don't want you to die here.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Your plan should not and will not succeed. What are you so obsessed with?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough* *cough*...
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Hey, you're awake.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Sorry, I was hired to cause you a bit of trouble.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: By the way, we're on a pharmaceutical delivery truck, and the windshield was broken by a stray bolt.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: It took quite a bit of effort to get you here. Fortunately, we can take a breather now that we're in the underground transport tunnels.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: This place is most chaotic in the early hours of morning. Outsourcing, irregular transactions, vehicles turned over 'accidentally'...
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Wh-What do you want? Where's Aloisia?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Your bodyguard? She should be waiting outside the city, if she cooperates. I needed her to create a distraction.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Don't worry, no archer is going to be a problem for a caster of her skills.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: As for us... we're here to help, I guess, but we're not exactly doing this pro bono. And the client is a bit of a penny pincher, if you catch my drift.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: So, we've got a few wounded, and I think we ought to discuss your ransom. To cover the medical expenses, so to speak.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Now, will you be so kind as to put away your wand? I've always found casters from Leithanien to be a headache.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Very well. I will pay a reasonable ransom, I will ask no questions, and I won't attempt to track you down afterwards.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: We shall negotiate like civilized people.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Excellent. I'm just doing my job. Once this truck gets the goods to the destination, it'll only be a short wait before we get out.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...I hear empty crates.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Oh, I'm not suggesting that you're the goods.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The truck was rented, and the permit borrowed. Gotta put up appearances, after all.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Plus, in the event that something happens to your bodyguard, this cross-border business permit will give us a reason to drop you off outside Kazimierz.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Who do you...
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Never mind, I don't want to know.
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Good. Now how about we talk money, to pass the time?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: You ask what I'm obsessed with?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.text: This society has clear-cut rules. When the price of everything in life is clearly marked and labeled, it doesn't take a calculator to make the optimum decision.
But why are we not allowed to choose less wisely?
I know the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi Kazimierz invited you, as they invited every Nearl.
Not to mention the businessmen who would have every last knight humiliated in the arena.
You could have had great power, great prestige, great wealth. You could have saved so many people.
But you didn't.
You're a stubborn one too. Why are you trying to persuade me?

attributes.content: I returned to the ranks of the campaign knights, to the path of vassalage, in order to seek those who walk the same path.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...Do not misunderstand, Młynar. It's not war that I seek. War is inevitable, and the knights must carry that burden.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Many have never seen the shadow beneath Leithanien's spire, never heard the wailing in the northern wind, which is why they can cheer for the blood spilled in the arena. But I bear no grudge against them.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Chivalry may shine among the campaign knights, but it does not come from the glint of a sword. It is not authority through violence that I want to show people, nor the bones and smoldering ruins spread across the barrenlands.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: What I want to show them is that one does not have to trample upon other lives... That one can also choose to sacrifice oneself for others.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: That's what a knight sheds their blood for.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The honor of a knight needs no testimony.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: How can you claim to uphold chivalry, when you have given up the ground on which you stand and left your fate to a war you have no control over?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Can you continue to shed tears and feel sorrow for the dead who line your path?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: A drop of rain falls upon the tip of the spear.
The forest's night fog glows, as though the dawn has come early in the drizzle.
Finally, you're not holding back your Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I'm in full gear, while you're not even wearing basic armor. Is this really a fair duel?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: What armor can bear the full brunt of a campaign knight's blow? Especially one from you?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Yes, it's perfect.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Wait, you're...
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: Hey, good eyes.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Some nobles didn't even realize until two months into our partnership.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Others realized it immediately, but kept their mouths shut as though they didn't know anything.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Sarkaz mercenaries. Has the business machine of Kazimierz taken in your ilk too?
attributes.name: Leithanian Noble

attributes.content: You flatter us. It's no skin off my nose whatever you think we are, but there are more than just Sarkaz hiding here.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Kazimierz treats us all equally... when it's deciding who to throw away.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: Spooked?
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: The only thing unusual about a Sarkaz is that we live a bit longer than the average Kazimierzian. And I'm still pretty young.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: ...Although it's true that I have fewer and fewer old friends by the year.
attributes.name: Toland

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Silver shards litter the ground in the falling rain.
The broken armor cannot keep the blood inside.
It's over.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: No...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Who do you want me to admit defeat to?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The campaign knight grabs his lance again and lunges forward.
But his legs do not move.
...Who do you want me to admit defeat to?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The knight stumbles and falls to his knees as the golden light rains down on his cheeks.
He raises his head and gazes at Nearl, his eyes wide open in the rain.
To the nobles in the high tower of the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi Kazimierz, who spend their days in intrigue and vainglory?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Or to the merchants who cover up their dark deeds with false mirth, and disguise their twisted greed with contrived jest?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Do you want me to admit that I can never win against the tyranny of bloodlines?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Or do you want me to flee Kazimierz, abandon the struggle, and bow down to all that we despised?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: *cough*...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I never saw another path worth taking.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You still won't admit the only possibility, will you? Then prove it with your sword.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: If it's you who thinks I'm wrong, then... I'll accept it.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I didn't lose to power, to money, to the will to survive, or to inexorable time.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Młynar sheathes his sword.
The rain of light continues to fall from the cold night sky before the dawn.
Like I said... you don't need to die here.
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: If he turned back, it would stop, he thought.
...Hah.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: How do you live with it, Młynar?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Even though your fury burns so much fiercer than mine, even though you've seen the same things I have?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Don't tell me you don't see it...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: The G.C.C. meddles with the campaign knights at will. More and more knights sell their honor and their swords to those merchants, fueling their increasing ambition.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: As for Leithanien... much time has passed since the fall of the Witch King's spire. I have seen with my own eyes their war preparations. There is no romanticism in it, only terror.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: And there will always be those who roam the barrenlands, made pariah by Catastrophe, war, and the evolution of the cities.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You know all this, so... why do you not draw your sword?
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.text: His vision blurs and he cannot see Młynar's expression, only that he is still gazing down on him.
Why do you hesitate? What are you thinking?
He finds no answer in the rain, only golden starlight melting in his field of vision.
Every breath he takes is a struggle, as his life flows out along his cold armor.

attributes.content: ...And that scornful sneer from up high, which awaits all who passionately pursue their ideals.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.text: Not the numb spectators who snigger as I weep for the victims.
I feel equal sorrow from them as I do for the dead.
It's the ones who are even now sneering at my futile efforts against them.
Even if I banged my head so hard against this wall that my bones shattered into dust, there would be no echo.
The rain does not stop. His eyes remain wide.
He recalls the summer downpour, the muddy forest ground, the ring of wild flowers flowing on the stream.
He remembers the last good dream he had in those times.
You should not be so silent, Nearl, he thought.

attributes.content: —Just like then, you must return to The Grand Knight Territory, after a long and futile journey.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I don't believe you can let it go, Młynar.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...Their two names were erased just as they shined the brightest, like a fire thrown into a deep pool, going out without a trace.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: For fifteen years the Adeptus Sprawiedliwi has remained silent. Your questions have gone unanswered.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: House Nearl, bright as they are, was rejected by Kazimierz... The nation has sunken into darkness, and will not abide even a single ray of light.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: That's why you became disillusioned...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: You... don't know how many years they've waited in foreign lands.
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: ...What did you say?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Ha...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: I encountered them a few years ago, when infiltrating Leithanien...
attributes.name: Czcibor

attributes.content: Drip.
A single drop of ink stained the last letter from home.
He never had the chance to send a letter asking the question that he harbored for twenty years.
After twenty years of silence, he knows this is the only thing he can ask the campaign knight.
...Did you tell anyone else about this?
attributes.name: Młynar

attributes.content: Czcibor shakes his head.
Młynar waits in long silence for the next rebuke, and even longer for a word of repentance.
But the only response is a long exhalation, like a sigh, followed by the soft sound of clanging metal.
The campaign knight's body leans towards his lance that pierced the earth.
It is like one of the countless suits of empty armor they have seen on the barrenlands.
After a moment, Młynar kneels in the rain, making a gesture of mourning for his former comrade.
